data.title: Silkmen moving on up
data.meta_description: Macclesfield moved into a Vanarama Conference play-off spot after winning 2-0 at high-flying Eastleigh.
data.text:
ByPA Sport Report

Published 30/08/2014 at 16:31 GMT

Macclesfield moved into a Vanarama Conference play-off spot after winning 2-0 at high-flying Eastleigh.

Eurosport

Image credit: Eurosport

Striker Domaine Rouse opened the scoring after 32 minutes when he nodded in a perfectly-placed Scott Barrow cross.

Paul Lewis nearly doubled the Silkmen's advantage after the break but his 25-yard effort just skimmed over goalkeeper Ross Flitney's crossbar.

Midfielder Lewis did get his goal midway through the second half, though, with an excellent diving header after a curling delivery from Paul Turnbull.

Premier League

Haaland scores again on opening weekend as Man City cruise past Chelsea

3 minutes ago

Flitney got a vital hand to a close-range Waide Fairhurst header to prevent a third but Eastleigh could not muster a fightback as they recorded their second loss of the season.
